hints.content:
Each pack has $\purpleC8$ cards.

Anastasia bought $\greenD{64}$ total cards.

[[☃ image 1]]

How many $\blueD{\text{groups}}$ are there?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of unequal lengths, a first tape labeled 64 and a shorter second tape with one part labeled 8. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the first tape is labeled with a question mark and the words equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}\times\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} = \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\purpleC8\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{64}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}=\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} $

So, $\greenD{64}\div \purpleC8=\blueD{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many packs of cards Anastasia bought are:

 - $\purpleC8\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{64}$  
 - $\greenD{64}\div \purpleC8=\blueD{\text{?}}$

question.content:
Anastasia buys several packs of  Wonky Wizard trading cards.  Each pack has $8$ cards, and Anastasia buys a total of $64$ cards.  

**Which equations would help us find out how many packs of cards Anastasia bought?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
